text: Talk to Cyrene about the future plans

title: Mission Description
content: You have seen the past of Amphoreus. Now, you shall shape its future. How will you stand against the weight of destiny? The companion beside you and the sages who walk with you will definitely clear the clouds of doubt.

speaker: Cyrene
line: ( Trailblazer )'s surprised expression is just like what the memories recorded.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Rather than "knowing" you, it might be better described as... I "remember" you...?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: It's me, (Trailblazer). Don't you recognize me? Or did I really change that much?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Is this... a new way to chat someone up?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Well, I guess you did see the end of countless Cyrenes, in a way of speaking. But I'm standing before you right here, right now, as alive as ever. Isn't that a good thing?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: It's me, (Trailblazer). Don't you recognize me? Or did I really change that much?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Maybe I'm both? Just kidding. If I had to choose... Then I'm probably closer to the latter.

speaker: Cyrene
line: It's pretty unbelievable for me too. It's like I had a long, long dream. Cyrene's memories... and Mem's memories... they're all tangled together. But when I woke up... there were only broken fragments left.

speaker: Cyrene
line: I can't remember what happened in those thirty million cycles, but I remember what you, (Trailblazer), did for this world.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Like... Didn't you wish for me to turn into a pretty girl back at the Grove ?

text: Then is this my wish coming true?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Yep. Isn't it amazing? It's like a seed finally grew up and became a flower! And I'm definitely as cute as a flower now.

text: You remembered that? Please remember something good next time.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Hey. Everything about you is good, (Trailblazer). That's why I'll remember all of it.

text: Wait. I didn't pick that option.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Huh? You didn't? Teehee~ In that case, just treat it as my own wish then!

speaker: Cyrene
line: There's so much I want to say, but unfortunately... this isn't the time to reminisce.

speaker: Cyrene
line: With the memoreis of the previous Flame-Chase still intact, we've returned to this place at the beginning of time, so we can carry out our promise to Phainon .

speaker: Cyrene
line: The descent of Irontomb may be looming over the horizon... but we still have a chance to change everything.

speaker: Cyrene
line: In Cyrene's memories, she always sits by the lake, gently swaying on the swing, like she's waiting for someone.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: I don't know... It sounds weird, doesn't it? It's something that happened to me, but I'm talking as if I'm an observer.

text: It was the same for Phainon...

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Yes. Phainon, too, embarked on his journey because of this view... He then walked alone for more than thirty million cycles.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Thankfully, you arrived during his long wait, (Trailblazer).

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Is that also why "Cyrene" did what she did? It's something that happened to me, but I'm talking as if I'm an observer.

speaker: Cyrene
line: But that's just what those memories are like... Vague and unclear, as if encased in thick ice. The only things I remember are the days I spent with you.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Amphoreus will fall into an ending of "Destruction" after the next "Era Nova"...

speaker: Cyrene
line: But those stories went out of fashion ages ago. In a proper romantic epic, the hero's supposed to foil the villain's plot, right?

text: Lygus is the primary culprit behind everything.
We need the help of more allies from beyond the sky.
Find a good spot to contact the geniuses
Wait for Cyrene and take in the sights of Aedes Elysiae once more
Return to the mysterious space and continue the adventure

title: Step Description
content: Every expedition begins with a storm that foretells the hardships to come. On the audience's seats in the Exomyth, the only audience member leads you into the story titled "Before Their Deaths," and thus draws the curtain on a tragedy.

text: Investigate the display monitor at the end
Something's not right... Check the display monitor again
